intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium levicaule subsp. kuhmoniemiense, commonly known as the Kuhmoniemi hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to northern Finland and parts of Scandinavia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and yellowish to reddish flower heads. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest edges and meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
